In his remarks, Lomax touched on the critical role education plays in living out Martin Luther King 's dream.`` Among the rights Martin Luther King fought for was the right to an education,'' he said. But his life was tragically cut short before he could lead us in the fight to afford the college education we needed, and the right to attend public schools that would prepare us to gain admission to and graduate from the colleges we had the legal right to attend. That battle he left for us. The breakfast got its start when UNCF and the Colin Powell Mills Foundation joined together to host a community celebration to honor the legacy of Martin Luther King . embroiled Prime Minister David Cameron 's media chief. Keir Starmer , Director of Public Prosecutions, said the Crown Prosecution Service( CPS) would conduct a`` comprehensive assessment'' of evidence collected by detectives. The purpose of this assessment is to ascertain whether there is any material which could now form evidence in any future criminal prosecution relating to phone hacking, the CPS said in a statement. David Cameron 's communications chief Andy Coulson quit as News of the World editor in 2007 after one of the paper's reporters was jailed for secretly listening to phone messages of royal

. Andy Coulson denies being aware of any wrongdoing at the paper, part of Rupert Murdoch 's News Corp media group, and police said last month there was not enough evidence to charge him with any crime. Obviously when he was editor of the News of the World, bad things happened at that newspaper and when he found about those, he resigned. That was the right thing to do, David Cameron told BBC Radio 4's Today program.
